name: corrugated ribbing
description: a two-color ribbing in which the knits are worked in one color and the purls in a second color.

name: illusion/shadow
description: a knitting and crochet technique that produces an hidden image that is only viewable from an angle.

name: Intarsia
description: colorwork technique used to create separate blocks of color and in which each area of color has its own separate length of yarn.

name: mosaic
description: colorwork technique in which the color pattern is made by slipping stitches, with only one color is worked on each row.

name: stranded
description: multi-color knitting with all yarn used in the row/round carried across the back of the work.

name: stripes / colorwork
description: Alternating sections of two or more colors

name: bias
description: worked on the diagonal.

name: bottom up
description: worked from the bottom of the garment/accessory toward the top.

name: buttonholes
description: a small hole or slit in a garment or piece of fabric used for fastening a button.

name: double knitting
description: a knitting technique in which one works with two yarns simultaneously to create two separate pieces of fabric that may be joined at the sides and bottom or remain unconnected.

name: entrelac
description: a knitting and crochet technique used to create a textured diamond or basketwork pattern.

name: felted/fulled
description: a finishing process in which the animal fiber fabric is subjected to moisture, heat, and friction so that the fibers cling together, thus shrinking considerably to make a denser and thicker fabric.

name: freeform
description: crochet or knitting worked in seemingly random shapes, colors, and techniques.

name: gusset
description: an insertion of an extra shape of fabric separate from the main body of knitting, typically in the shape of a triangle or diamond, used to increase strength or aid in movement.

name: icord
description: a narrow tube of knitting worked in the round that is often used for the handles of a bag, cords to tie on a hat, to edge a garment, or for a decorative effect.

name: kitchener/grafting
description: a method of connecting the live stitches of two pieces of knitting by following loops of knit or purl stitches, resulting in a seamless look.

name: modular / join as you go
description: a technique in which small pieces of fabric are joined together as they are worked to make a larger item.

name: moebius
description: A twisted shape with only one side worked by using a moebius cast-on with a circular needle or twisted cast-on in crochet and working outward, or by joining the ends of a flat piece with a 1/2 twist.

name: motifs
description: components or elements that are worked separately and either joined as they are worked or seamed together after completion. Does not apply to colorwork design motifs.

name: one-piece
description: worked in one piece, either seamlessly or with seams.

name: provisional cast-on
description: A cast-on worked with waste yarn that is later removed so the cast-on stitches can be picked up and knit in the opposite direction.

name: seamed
description: worked as individual pieces, joined together with a seam.

name: seamless
description: not joined by or having seams

name: selvedge
description: edge stitches, usually only one or two stitches distinct from the body of the garment (such as a slipped stitch or a single garter stitch at the end/beginning of each row).

name: short rows
description: A technique where partial rows are worked back and forth, adding a curve, bulge, or shaping to an otherwise flat piece.

name: sideways
description: Worked from side to side rather than top down or bottom up.

name: steeks
description: A vertical column of knitted stitches intended to be cut apart  during the finishing of the item.

name: three needle bind off
description: A method of joining two pieces together in knitting in which the live stitches from two pieces are knit together and cast off with a third needle.

name: thrums
description: Short pieces of roving or other thick material used to add thickness and insulation. Ususally creates a decorative V-shaped pattern on the public side of the piece.

name: top down
description: worked from the top of the garment/accessory toward the bottom.

name: twined knitting
description: A technique, originating in Sweden, that uses two strands of yarn (usually two ends of the same ball of yarn) which are twined between stitches.  Also called two-end knitting, or Tvåändsstickning

name: worked flat
description: worked back-and-forth in rows.

name: worked in the round
description: Worked in a continuous around and around fashion. Can be flat (like a circular shawl started from the center) or tubular (like a sock or sleeve).

name: broomstick crochet
description: a technique that utilizes a large dowel, broomstick, or knitting needle to create large loops that are incorporated into a lacy fabric.

name: bruges crochet
description: a technique imitating bobbin-made braid/tape laces.

name: bullion / roll stitch
description: a technique that creates a wrapped look or "bullion" around the stitch.

name: clones knot
description: a small knot made by making a chain, alternately wrapping the thread around the hook and chain, then drawing a loop through all loops on hook. A slip stitch is worked over the base of knot to close.

name: cro-hook / croknit
description: a variation of tunisian crochet that uses a double ended hook to create a double sided fabric.

name: cro-tatting / crochet
description: a cross between needle tatting and crochet, made with straight hooks like those used in bullion crochet.

name: filet crochet
description: a grid-like type of crocheted lace fabric which uses only two crochet stitches: the chain stitch and the double crochet stitch (or treble).

name: front/back post stitch
description: a stitch which is worked around the "post" of the stitch in the previous row, instead of into the top of the stitch like in a "normal" crochet stitch.

name: granny square
description: crochet square motifs (many possible variations).

name: hairpin crochet
description: a textile-making technique in which a lacy fabric is made by forming open, looped stitches with a crochet hook and a hairpin lace loom, a small handheld tool having two parallel metal prongs around which the loops are formed.

name: Irish crochet
description: a technique characterized by separately crocheted motifs later assembled into a mesh background, which usually employs several sizes of thread. Padded crochet, multiple thicknesses of thread (the thickest is used for the padding cord), and joining-while-b

name: lover's knot/Solomon's knot/knot stitch
description: a crochet technique in which a single crochet is worked into an elongated loop. Creates a mesh-like, open fabric.

name: pineapple crochet
description: a common traditional lacy motif resembling a pineapple in shape which can be worked alone or joined, or used as a design element in a crocheted lace item.

name: slip stitch crochet
description: A technique using only slip stitches to create fabric. Usually thinner and stretchier than other crochet fabric, sometimes has the appearance of knitted fabric. Also referred to as pjoning, Bosnian crochet and shepherd’s knitting.

name: surface crochet
description: a method in which embellishments or designs are added by crocheting them onto/into the finished fabric.

name: tapestry crochet
description: a technique using multiple yarns, usually in different colors, that are carried across to create a motif; also referred to as mosaic, jacquard, intarsa, colorwork, fair-isle, or hard crochet.

name: Tunisian / afghan crochet
description: typically worked on a long hook with a stopper on the end; creates a fabric that looks almost woven instead of either knitted or crocheted. Also referred to as Afghan Crochet or Afghan Stitch.

name: A line
description: a garment that is fitted around one point, most commonly the shoulders or the waist, and gradually widens out toward the hem giving the impression of a capital letter A.

name: appliqued / embellished
description: fabric has a smaller ornament or embellishment applied to its surface for decoration.

name: asymmetric
description: designed to be unbalanced on ppposite sides of the finished object.

name: back fastening
description: utilizes some type of closure at the back of a garment or piece.

name: beads / pailettes
description: embellished with beads or pailettes.

name: box pleats
description: a style of please that is actually two pleats facing opposite directions to make a flat surface between pleats; can be reversible.

name: buttoned
description: embellished or fastened with buttons or something button-like.

name: circular yoke
description: a yoke with a rounded look which integrates shoulder and neck, with shaping spread evenly around circumference.

name: convertible
description: designed to be changed from one style to another.

name: cropped
description: shortened or clipped in length.

name: darts
description: a decrease/increase along a line which creates shaping.

name: double breasted
description: fastened by overlapping one edge of the front over the other, usually with a double row of buttons.

name: duplicate stitch
description: embellishment technique using a second yarn (often of a contrasting color) and tapestry needle to create a design on a piece of fabric by working over existing stitches.

name: embroidery
description: surface embellishment worked on the finished piece using a thread/string/yarn and tapestry needle.

name: empire waist
description: waist shaping (seamed or not) that falls just under the bustline.

name: facings
description: pieces of material that are folded back & inside, usually at the edges of a garment but sometimes over a seam.

name: fringe
description: Decorative edging consisting of lengths of yarn or fabric attached at one end to the work.

name: front fastening
description: utilizes some type of closure at the front of a garment or piece.

name: gathers
description: small fold or pucker made by gathering fabric together.

name: hems
description: An edge finish that consists of a folded back edge that is then fastened down.

name: hood
description: A covering for the head and neck.

name: lined
description: has a material or fabric that covers all or part of the inner surface of the garment or item.

name: notched
description: has a v-shaped cut or indentation.

name: peplum
description: a short flared, ruffled, or gathered, strip attached to the waistline of a garment to create a frill or flounce.

name: picots
description: a series of small, ornamental looped shapes which form a decorate edge or embellishment to fabric.

name: racer back
description: a back treatment for sleeveless garments which is formed by extra deep armholes or straps that meet at a narrow back.

name: ruffles
description: fabric that is significantly wider at one edge than the opposite edge, resulting in a frilled or flounced appearance.

name: shoulder fastening
description: having fastenings on the shoulders.

name: single breasted
description: coat, jacket, cardigan or vest with a single row of buttons.  Front pieces usually only overlap for the width of the button band.

name: snaps
description: enclosures or fasteners for a garment that are made up of two pieces that fit into one another and snap together to secure the two pieces of the garment.

name: straight
description: without shaping

name: stripes
description: Alternating sections of two or more colors or textures.

name: swing
description: an exagerrated, loosely flared shape, usually on a coat or jacket.

name: tassel / pompom
description: a dangling decorative trim or adornment consisting of a bunch of cords fastened at one end.

name: tied
description: fastened with tied cords/strings.

name: waist shaping
description: shaping in the waist area in order to give the garment a  defined waist.

name: wrap
description: garment that folds around the body.

name: zipper
description: item is fastened or embellished with a zipper.

name: collared
description: An extra length of fabric that is attached to the neck opening of a garment.

name: mandarin
description: A short standing collar that is separated by a gap at the front and/or back.  Also called a Nehru collar.

name: peter pan
description: a small flat collar that is rounded at the front.

name: rolled
description: a collar or edge treatment to for a neck that is closely rolled and and very short.

name: shawl collar
description: a wide, turned-over collar of a garment that combines with lapels forming an unbroken curving line.

name: shirt
description: short folded collar that opens in the middle and has pointed ends. Sometimes fastens with buttons.

name: crocheted edging
description: an edge that is added to a piece using a crochet hook.

name: icord edging
description: An edge to that is added to fabric (applied either during the construction or after, during finishing) made of a narrow tube worked in stockinette.

name: lace edging
description: an edge of an item that includes open work in knitted or crocheted lace

name: ballet neck
description: a high, wide scoop neck.

name: boat neck
description: a neckline created when two rectangles are sewn together (sometimes overlapping) leaving an unshaped opening in the middle.

name: cowl neck
description: a loose-fitting, draped, turned-over neckline.

name: crew neck
description: a round neckline that is close to the neck.

name: funnel neck
description: a neckline/collar that is worked as an extension of the body and usually extends a short distance.

name: halter
description: a neckline with straps, bands, or ties that wrap around and connect at the nape of the neck.

name: henley
description: a neckline treatment with a placket (usually buttoned) and round neck, with a band or no collar.

name: keyhole neck
description: a neckline with a rounded opening which closes at the top.

name: mock turtle
description: a tube neck, shorter than a turtleneck, generally with no foldover.

name: scoop neck
description: a low rounded neckline. aan be almost as short as a crew neck or very deep.

name: square neck
description: a neckline that has distinct corners in the front, with parallel side edges.

name: surplice
description: a cross over necklin which can be constructed as a wrap front garment or as a single front with one layer of the neckline under the other.

name: sweetheart neck
description: a rounded v-neck which creates a shape like a heart.

name: turtle neck
description: a tall rolled or folded collar, which is called turtleneck in the US, polo neck in the UK.

name: v neck
description: a neckline with straight sides that meet at a pointed bottom.

name: afterthought pocket
description: a pocket added after the garment is completed

name: any pockets
description: has another type of pocket incorporated into the design not included in the list

name: hidden / inseam
description: a pocket in the garment seam that isn't readily visible

name: patch
description: a pocket made from a separate piece that's sewn on

name: set-in
description: a pocket whose opening is knitted into the body of a garment

name: 3/4 length
description: a sleeve that ends halfway between the wrist bone and the elbow.

name: any sleeves
description: not sleeveless.

name: bracelet length
description: sleeve ends slightly above the wrist bone.

name: cap
description: a very short sleeve style which covers the top of shoulder and usually has little or no length at the underarm.

name: contiguous
description: a technique where the shoulder seams and sleeve caps of a garment are worked from the top down.

name: cuffed
description: sleeve has a cuff, fold, or band that serves as the trim or finish to the bottom.

name: dolman
description: a sleeve usually formed integrally with the front and back with a deep armhole starting low on the body; often shaped like a large triangle tapering at the wrist.

name: drop
description: a shoulder seam that extends beyond the natural shoulder edge and usually creates a wider fitting sleeve.

name: elbow
description: sleeve ends at the elbow

name: flutter
description: a short, loose sleeve that falls in folds over the upper arm.

name: long
description: sleeve ends at the wrist bone or later

name: modified drop
description: a drop sleeve with minimal shaping at the armpit to reduce fabric bulk.

name: Nalgar (EZ notation)
description: diagonal armhole shaping running from the underarm to the middle of the sleeve. Reverse shaping to Raglan.

name: puffed
description: sleeves with extra fullness at the shoulder, generally gathered or pleated at the top of the armhole seam and again in a band at the sleeve bottom.

name: raglan
description: diagonal armhole shaping, running from the underarm to the neckline.

name: saddle shoulder
description: a sleeve with a narrow strip that extends to the neckline which creates two shoulder seams rather than one.

name: set in
description: armhole shaping like that on a 'traditional' dress or buttondown shirt.  A scooped shape at the underarm extending in a straight line up to the shoulder.

name: short
description: a sleeve that ends above the elbow.

name: sleeveless
description: a garment that is without any sort of sleeve

name: tulip
description: a sleeve, usually short or cap, consisting of two layers that overlap at the outside of the arm like the shape of petals of a tulip.

name: bobble / popcorn / nupp
description: a set of stitches forming a raised bump

name: brioche / tuck stitch
description: Fabric with tucked stitches (yarn overs that are knitted together with a slipped stitch from the previous row). Such stitches may also be made by knitting into the row below and dropping the stitch above.

name: cables
description: crossing one set of stitches over another

name: chevron / flame stitch
description: A  stitch pattern that causes the fabric to make zigzags.

name: dropped stitches
description: knit stitches that are dropped and allowed to unravel producing open, vertical stripes in the fabric

name: elastic
description: fabric that easily returns to its original shape after being stretched

name: eyelets
description: a fabric that incorporates yarn overs to create a hole used for  either aesthetic or funtional purposes

name: lace
description: a pattern of stable holes that are arranged to create a decorative fabric

name: mesh
description: a simple, open fabric resembling netting

name: reversible
description: Both sides of  the fabric are attractive enough to be considered the "right" side

name: ribbed / ribbing
description: fabric creating a verticallyl ridged pattern

name: ripple
description: a horizontal undulating wave pattern.

name: slipped stitches
description: in knitting, stitches moved from one needle to  the other without being worked; in crochet, stitiches used when a crochet stitch doesn't need added height

name: smocked
description: fabric gathered at certain locations to bring in, or reduce width or height

name: textured
description: A mix of stitches providing surface interest

name: twisted stitches
description: Stitches worked so the legs are  crossed

name: adult
description: 18 years or over

name: baby
description: birth to 12  months

name: child (4-12)
description: 4 to 12 years

name: doll
description: scaled for a toy figure

name: newborn
description: to fit a newborn baby

name: preemie
description: to fit a premature baby

name: teen (13-17)
description: 13 to 17 years

name: toddler (1-3)
description: 1 to 3 years

name: negative ease
description: measurements of garment are  smaller than the corresponding body measurements, creating a snugger  fit

name: no ease
description: measurements of  the garment are the same as corresponding body measurments

name: positive ease
description: measurements of the garment are  larger than corresponding body measurements

name: fitted
description: fits close to the body

name: maternity fit
description: extra length and extra width/room is added to the waist to  accomodate a pregnant woman's stomach

name: miniature
description: designed to fit small-scale items

name: oversized fit
description: large amount of positive ease used as a design element.

name: petite fit
description: contains instructions for size XS and smaller

name: plus fit
description: contains instructions for size XL and larger

name: tall fit
description: contains instructions for taller individuals

name: female
description: Usually used or worn by females

name: male
description: Usually used or worn by males

name: unisex
description: Used or worn by anyone

name: Mature Content
description: pattern or pattern images are not appropriate for all ages

name: chart
description: uses a visual  made of symbols and/or shapes to convey directions

name: has machine instructions
description: Instructions for machine knitting are provided in the pattern

name: has schematic
description: includes a drawing, probably with measurements

name: low vision
description: pattern instructions are available in a format that is designed for low vision readers

name: photo tutorial
description: uses photographs or drawings to show  the neccesary steps

name: recipe - percentage / calculated
description: not a precise, step-by-step pattern

name: video tutorial
description: uses a video to show methods/steps used in creation

name: written pattern
description: uses words to describe the techniques involved

name: amigurumi
description: stuffed animals and anthropomorphic creatures made in a style of crochet and knitting originating in Japan.

name: Andean / Peruvian
description: using construction techniques and/or colorwork motifs derived from Peru and/or the Andean mountains of South America.

name: Aran
description: a style of work that includes intricate designs using cables, bobbles and other decorative elements that originated in the Aran Islands of Ireland.

name: Bavarian
description: A style of textured knitting employing twisted stitches, traveling stitches, and narrow cables.

name: Cowichan (Salish)
description: colorwork sweaters, usually featuring distinctive shawl collars and made with bulky yarns and in geometric and bird/animal motifs traditionally done by the Canadian Cowichan First Nations people.

name: Danish
description: regional knitting style from Denmark - textured patterning worked in knits and purls.

name: Estonian
description: regional style of stranded colorwork or detailed, textured lace from Estonia.

name: Fair Isle
description: stranded colorwork specific to the Fair Isle and Shetland regions of Scotland using no more than two colors per row, limited color runs, and featuring distictive color banding.

name: Faroese
description: created with traditional techniques from the Faroe Islands, most often lace shawls with special shaping in the shoulders and a back gusset.

name: Finnish / Suomi
description: traditional colorwork and lace designs created with techniques and motifs originating in Finland.

name: Guernsey / Gansey
description: traditional knitting, often of seamans' sweaters, developed on the Channel Island of Guernsey. Sweaters often feature a raised shoulder seam, underam gussets and a split at the hem.

name: Icelandic
description: stranded colorwork or lace patterns (often circular-yoke Lopi sweaters or lace shawls which can be multi-colored) created with traditional Icelandic techniques and motifs.

name: Irish
description: knitting or crochet created with techniques traditionally from Ireland. Often includes richly cabled garments (knitting) or floral/lace motifs (crochet).

name: Latvian
description: techniques derived from the various regions of the Baltic state of Latvia, often used in mittens

name: Norwegian
description: a variety of stranded colorwork, often two colors but sometimes three or more in a single row

name: Orenburg
description: very fine geometric lace originating in Orenburg, Russia

name: Sami
description: created with techniques from the indigenous S\u00e1mi people of Scandinavia and European Russia

name: Shetland
description: very fine, traditional geometric lace or Fair Isle colorwork originating in the Shetland Islands.

name: Swedish
description: distinct styles of garment shaping and patterning originating in Sweden, including Bohus styes and Tvåändsstickning, or twined knitting.

name: Turkish
description: created with techniques traditionally from Turkey, often a form of colorwork featuring diagonal lines & geometric patterns

name: 3 dimensional
description: an object that has height, width and depth

name: circle
description: a shape where all the edges are the same distance from a central point

name: crescent
description: the shape produced when a circle has a segment of another circle removed from its edge

name: cube
description: three dimensional figure made of six squares

name: half-circle
description: half of a circle as divided by diameter

name: hexagon
description: six-sided shape

name: octagon
description: eight-sided shape

name: oval
description: egg shaped

name: pentagon
description: five-sided shape

name: pyramid
description: three dimensional figure made of four triangles

name: rectangle
description: four-sided with opposite sides of equal length, adjacent sides are at 90 degree  angles to each other

name: sphere
description: three dimensional figure all points of which are equidistant from a fixed point

name: square
description: four-sided with all sides of equal length, adjacent sides are at 90 degree angles to  each other

name: star
description: shaped like a star

name: triangle
description: three-sided shape

name: no shaping
description: sock leg is worked straight, with no increases/decreases

name: seamed sock
description: worked flat and then seamed

name: shaped arches
description: increased width towards the heel to add an arch to the foot of a sock

name: starting in middle
description: worked from the middle to each end

name: toe up
description: A method of making socks that uses the toe as a starting point

name: top/cuff down
description: a method of making socks that uses the top of the sock cuff as a starting point

name: two at a time
description: instructions given for creating both socks simultaneously

name: afterthought heel
description: a heel added to the sock after the rest of the sock is created

name: Dutch heel
description: a square flap pulled together under the heel by a series of short rows.

name: heel flap
description: heel created by working a flap flat and then turning the heel

name: short row heel
description: A heel worked flat using short-rows to taper to the tip

name: short row toe
description: a toe worked flat using short-rows to taper to the tip

name: star
description: a toe resulting in a star-like wavy "X" when complete.

name: wide
description: a toe with more stitches between the decreases, making a wider side section
